<form> <fieldset> <div class="checkbox"> <label> <input type="checkbox" value=""> Option one is this and that&mdash;be sure to include why it's great </label> </div> <div class="checkbox disabled"> <label> <input type="checkbox" value="" disabled> Option two is disabled </label> </div> <div class="radio"> <label> <input type="radio" name="optionsRadios" id="optionsRadios1" value="option1" checked> Option one is this and that&mdash;be sure to include why it's great </label> </div> <div class="radio"> <label> <input type="radio" name="optionsRadios" id="optionsRadios2" value="option2"> Option two can be something else and selecting it will deselect option one </label> </div> <div class="radio disabled"> <label> <input type="radio" name="optionsRadios" id="optionsRadios3" value="option3" disabled> Option three is disabled </label> </div> </fieldset> </form>
